job_title: Infrastructure Data Cabling Engineer in Dallas, TX
pros: None to talk about at this time
cons:
Training is expected to be done on employees' own time.
The hiring process was done for a specific job after job everyone new-laid off.
employees are expected to pay their own Gass to all jobs under 50 miles from the Office so if you lived on the opposite side of town you might have to drive 200 hundred miles round trip daily to a job site with no compensation.
If you were privileged to get a company vehicle they deducted money from your pay on a scale depending on how far you lived from the office ie 0-20 miles they deducted $25 dollars per week from your pay.

pros:
1. Good payment,got your salary before end of the month.

4. Not busy at all.No overtime
cons:

2. COVID pandamic,No teambuilding events 
3. No snacks,No drink provides if you care about it.

pros:
As part of NCS team i have experienced the following:
1. I had the pleasure of being handled by managers who had our backs, who can recognize our strengths and maximize and showcase it, and also able to recognize our weakness and minimize them, or at times turn them into strength
2. I am encouraged to do better everytime.
3. Also discovers other aspects of our abilities, such as handling people within the team or external personnel
4. Management has always positive outlook of the project even under negative circumstances
5. For CSHL project, also recognized the achievement of team as well as individual achievements, which is very encouraging. The compensation for the hard work is satisfactory.
cons:
The following were my tough experiences:
1. At times, there will be situation of high turnover rates, sometimes including the management positions and keeping up with the project was tough
2. Salary increase is not much. I feel like my basic salary is too low for my current skills

review_title: working In NCS as a family
pros:
1) You learn that your own effort to learn and apply in fast pace environment will pays off eventually . Need not promotion , but rather experiences in soft skill and technical knowledge 
2) You have always been able to get help if you know the right people to reach out to . Best still , people are willing to listen , shares and contribute to your queries 
3) You build good relationship to people you working with . People are more to working solution and resolve things within their level 
4) There are many events and activities engaging staff that the company is trying to do , just that it' depends on individual to be engaged 
5) Like all big company , you are always encourage to seek your career path after you have been familiarize with your current department . you are encourage to explore.
cons:
1) sometimes , the work can be overwhelming , and that where you need to learn to pace and prioritize which matter most . applies to life too 
2) The changes at corporate level can be fast and need to listen out to information important to you

pros: Benefits are amazing and teammates are great
cons: Very hard to be a permanent staff

pros:
Many opportunities in govt projects
Many training courses available (though may not always have the budget or time to sign up)
cons:
It is quite a shock that the company has been existent as a SI for so many years, but there are no established processes and knowledge management content and hence, standards differ very much among similar projects. Though there are training courses available, but they are not made mandatory to some crucial roles like PMs, where many don't even know what are the basic tools or processes in the company. 
Cost cutting is strictly observed for the sake of doing it and there are no replacement of headcount even there are resignation cases and only when customers start banging tables and escalate to the sky, then the replacement request will be acceded. There is no investment in building the capabilities nor retention of good staff, but yet management will question why projects are not won.
Internal politics struggle among team in meeting their own agenda and revenue targets, and there is no synergy working among teams to leverage on each other's offerings and strength.
There are no KPIs enforced in performance appraisal and top down goals replicated from management to the staff. However, revenue targets given to the team are usually unachievable and unbelievable.

pros: Always busy with learning opportunity
cons: Always busy with long meetings

pros: Good place to work with
cons: Need more motivation to work with

pros: Some of the colleagues are very nice. The roti prata at the canteen is awesome. Also, there are plenty of people who somehow manage to find time to sleep at A2 and the rec room, so if you want to kun, you can go there.
cons:
Lots of politicking so work performance doesn't matter. Some departments do not set out KPIs at all for the year, so your performance appraisal totally depends on how much your boss likes you. So in spite of working hard for the company, at the end of the day, it's obvious the 'high performers' are the ones who go out with the boss for breakfast, lunch, coffee, smoke break, dinner! 

Also, the English and grammar used in this company is atrocious. When you pick up any brochure at the lobby to read, you have no idea what they're trying to say because it's all a bunch of IT jargon put together and you still don't know what the product is. It's pretty embarrassing especially when you have potential foreign clients.

Please do yourself a favour and try out at an MNC if you want to go into IT. At least they have KPIs and legitimate appraisals.

pros: company appreciate your work and team leaders are very helpful
cons: i don't any cons in this company

review_title: lack of opportunity for future growth
pros: job stability and good start off pay package
cons: no work life balance, management level is not compassionate to working level, overwhelmed with work

review_title: organization which values work life balance
pros:
- work life balance
- feedback are valued
cons: - fast pace organization, be prepared!

pros:
- I enjoyed working with my coworkers in the same department; they were kind and helpful all the times. 
- Decent benefits for a Singaporean company. 
- Good 9 to 5 jobs for family-oriented workers. 
- Decent CSR programs that allowed you to give back to the society.
- Decent pay rise.
cons:
- The sales teams could be overly aggressive and they would do anything to close their sales if the legal department did not stop them.  
- Do not expect too much bonus increase. 
- Rigid, conservative and old-fashioned management style (very much the opposite of Google). 
- The management team was reluctant to accept proposal for changes. 
- Work could be quite mundane and less challenging.

pros:
- I enjoyed working with my coworkers in the same department; they were kind and helpful all the times. 
- Decent benefits for a Singaporean company. 
- Good 9 to 5 jobs for family-oriented workers. 
- Decent CSR programs that allowed you to give back to the society.
- Decent pay rise.
cons:
- The sales teams could be overly aggressive and they would do anything to close their sales if the legal department did not stop them.

pros: Will be able to learn many things and can increase personal technical knowledge and domain knowledge, very good customer domain which comprises of various industries and mostly government, very good training package for personal development,
cons:
- If you are unlucky and is assigned to a lousy team then life will be hard in NCS as your work life in NCS will depend on how good your team lead and project manager manage the team. Workload is normal as normally IT work should be but careful about team management
- Human resource department is not operating as it should be. There is no clear guideline on salary review and updates on compensation package. Most information are outdated.

review_title: Good place to work but a little disorganised
pros: Nice bunch  of people, everyone is very welcoming and the atmosphere  is relaxed. The bosses are very understanding and there is generally very good communication between everyone. It is in the city centre so easy to get to. There is often cake in the kitchen!
cons: It can be very disorganized and often issues raised are not dealt with. The rules change a lot so it  is hard to keep up with standard procedure and it seems unfair that we are often expected to take on more responsibility without any change in pay.

pros: A very good opportunities for developing technical skills as most employees are in charged of multiple projects. Compensation is better than local SMEs, but there is a very big difference between contract staff and perm staff.  It is a good place for fresh graduates to pick up technical skills in the shortest time but not recommended for experience professionals. Promotion is not that hard for staff who network well with the management.
cons: Career advancement is not based on merit, but years of experience. Benefits wise it is very much depends on project budget (eg some projects get standby allowance, OT pay, time off, meal allowance, while others do not get anything besides basic salary). No work life balance as most projects are lack of resources. Turn over rate has always been very high, and the organization is hiring all year round.

review_title: Leaving office on time is SOP
pros: Good work life balance, you come on time, go back on time. Anything official after hour, will be compensated accordingly. Individual Development Planning provide chances for employee's to go for external courses with certifications. CEO never tired of writing communication email to communicate company directions and achievements globally every week. Strong parent company (SingTel) assure your job security. Cost cutting hurts globally but benefits Malaysians. Onshore (Australia) counterparts are helpful and very expert in what they do. Pantry filled with coffee machine, tea bags, milo powder, sugar, and unlimited supplies of biscuits.
cons: As usual, money is never enough because it's not an oil & gas industry. Minuscule HR team can't cope with the whole SingTel/NCS staff in NCSI (Malaysia), leaving staff neglected in terms of Team Building, moral and mental support, as well as company wide notification ( we used to get emails when someone in the company gave birth, or death, etc)

review_title: My experience with NCS is very pleasant with ample of opportunities for growth, except for the rewards component.
pros: NCS is a very established software integration house that is very strong in processes and project management. It has got enough capital and reserves to weather through many of the most difficult times such as SARS, H1N1, Asian and Global economic downturns.
cons: NCS' reward system is not known to be the best in the industry, although it strives to be a competitive one. In my opinion, it has grown to be over dependent on market surveys rather than using the general sentiment on the ground. As a result, talent retention continues to be one of the major issues plaguing the organisation.

pros: The few good aspects of NCS was the workshop sessions they conduct on periodic basis focusing on the latest technologies and their adoption of design thinking approach to project management
cons:
The expectation that I was informed during the start in the company was  that the client will shout at your face and you should have no qualms about it and you need to work any number of hours without break

The management is quite stone-hearted in their approach to new employees,  the long forever employees completely lost on the process and rely on archaic paper system and they have a tendency to claim charges for any expense they can think of from your salary.
The HR and the project team never see eye-to-eye and ball the employees between these departments with no consensus in what they discuss with the department and that with the employee. Hire with no vision on the project requirements.
 
To add to all, Gender discrimination was so prevalent in the organization. The standard was so low that it questions this organization  existence in such a world-class country.
The work culture and ethics is quite backward.

pros:
1) You will be given hell lot of importunity as long you are capable.
2) Generally good benefits compared to local company
3) Plenty of events (though you may have hard time finding time for it)
4) It's a place to train yourself in one of the toughest environment (FSIZ dept)
5) It's expanding overseas..so travelling opportunity is there
6) Generous bonus (~2.5months average)
cons:
1) Very small annual increment
2) You will really need to be very passionate, otherwise pressure and stress will override you
3) HR is not too friendly in helping employee. In fact, it's my worst experience facing them.
4) Long working hour (that's why you need passion)
5) Burden by political fight, if you are at newbie or intermediate

review_title: Not the ideal culture and environment for me
pros:
- not strict with time
- reimbursable allowances
cons:
- misalignment between region and local team
- region is micromanaging 
- too many governance that causes delays in providing feedback to the client (e.g indicative pricing for a project, services, etc.)
- competency is only concentrated at the region
- lack of human resource investment will only hire people if project was awarded
- lack of proper understanding of the local market
- unclear deleniation between presales, sales and delivery team
- hard to win projects because of expensive pricing and lack of value add services
- spread too thin and requires rigorous multi tasking that results to lack of quality in the work output

review_title: Learn a lot but burnt out in the process
pros:
Opportunities to work in many different type of projects (if lucky)
Good place to start for fresh graduate
cons:
Stuck with the same maintenance project for years (if unlucky)
Too profit driven, project cost doesn't match the manpower allocated for the project
Poor project management (if any) for some smaller projects

review_title: Good start for graduates but depends on your luck
pros:
- Training is provided for graduate
- Great benefits for staff welfare
cons:
- Some project doesn't provide any supervision for new comers
- Some project has a very messy structure and bad documentation 
- Comment on performance review doesn't reflect the given rating (comment is vague and useless)
- Unnecessary OT, work life balance rarely exist
- Some project has bad coding practice and no quality control

review_title: NCS does not have a good management. But has reasonable salary
pros:
Reasonable salary with good bonus for an IT firm
Good benefit for employee
Challenge working environment, with many nasty customer (Citibank, etc)
cons:
Technically, NCS allow people to transfer between department, but in reality, most manager will hold you as long as they can.
The project manager in NCS normally is selected by year of experience, not by leadership quality. Overall, they are not good.

review_title: Great place where people are friendly and benefits aplenty
pros: It is a place where politics aren't that prevalent as compared to most companies. Also, superiors treat you nicely and staff there are very friendly.
cons: Might be quite difficult to move up as they look heavily into your qualifications. Also, the nature of the job can get pretty mundane and opportunities to travel overseas are somewhat limited.

pros:
Stable job
Large company, several projects & industries, several aux departments e.g. training, architects
Good support for training
Well-known name (for better or worse)
cons:
Poor worklife balance in some departments e.g. banking
Little compensation for constant overtime
Lacking in cohesion/team events, distractions away from work
Not in control of the projects i.e. allow customers to lead by nose, too eager to take up bad projects

review_title: Nice RO but boss could be someone else
pros: Good exposure to jobs but treatment depends on PR skills and affinity with boss.
cons: No work-life balance although there are awareness activities.  Since most people work super late in dept(s), everyone is expected to do so.  Weird culture - Most bad local cultures can be found here.

review_title: Good work place for management people
pros:
- It's a good place to get exposure, especially if you starts as junior.
- Fast career move if you work in management
cons:
- Very bad compensation to keep the talent
- No career prospect for technical people
- Keep promoting education/training for employee, but full of rejection when asking for it

review_title: generally satisfied. Senior Management needs to be more innovative in the way of working.
pros: Colleagues are generally friendly; opportunities are given to work in different departments; chances are given to work in different domains.
cons: Staff is not given chance to fail; staff is not encouraged to learn new things; work and life balance is hard to achieve.

pros: Only the work location and the common food court is best
cons:
Only 2 projects are there so it is difficult you to get the project and if you luckily get the project you have to work on the non technical part like mannual testing even you have 3 years of experience as a Developer.
Once you got the project you do not have  the project release option. If you want release you will have to resign the job. 
HR people never support you they just say we are here only for you but always takes management side and torcher you.

pros: NCS was a great company to work for overall. With a well balanced work/life relationship they made it easy to continue on with them. We had a great direct manager that was always welcoming and handled everything extremely well.
cons: Overall felt that I had little involvement or insight as to what was happening in the company. Very secluded and kept to our own teams.

review_title: good colleagues and fun experience but room for improvements in the package given.
pros:
deal with a lot of new technology 
fun and good colleagues who work as a team in most of the time
cons: package is not competitive as performance review is not 360 degree where subordinates can review about their boss also.

review_title: good colleagues and fun experience but room for improvements in the package given.
pros:
deal with a lot of new technology 
fun and good colleagues who work as a team in most of the time
cons: package is not competitive as performance review is not 360 degree where subordinates can review about their boss also.

pros:
Work enviroment  is relaxed, Peers are helpful, There are training programs to help staff get better. 
Facilities are adequate. Management has very light touch.
cons: Management is not in touch with ground level. Lots of Politicking ,  Lots of Foreign employees. Benefits are quite minimal at my level. High Turnover rate.  Morale is quite low

review_title: Big IT company with frequency updates of technology
pros:
It emphasizes on employees' core values, especially integrity. Not only on their performance or skills.
It provides lots of valuable training. For example, Reporting writing training, leadership training etc.
The Office is big and grand. It's free to work there.
Reporting Officers monitor their following employees very tightly, ensure a fast learning environment
cons:
Competition is great here. Career path may be tight.
Overtime work is common.
People are serious in working and the environment is tensed.

review_title: Not bad. A place to learn
pros: You will get to learn a lot of skill sets that is up to date and integration between different forms of technology.
cons: Long working hours are definitely a must due to the requirements need to meet the datelines. Lots of work for the same amount of pay.

pros: Friendly peers, they wil never throw u out. If looking for a monotonous job and years of peaceful life, this is the place.
cons: Unless garmen fixes minimum pay for every position at NCS, they will continue to pay less than anyone else.

review_title: Not too bad of a company
pros: People were nice and that's good. Everyone likes to work with nice people. Hours were good, good balance of life and work.
cons: Low salary compared to industry average but not too bad. Not many other cons. Good company

pros:
Working environment is decent. Permanent staff have decent benefits.
Very nice colleagues.
cons:
Lots of OT.
Low pay.
Contract staff have to work at least 2 years under contract before they can be considered to convert to perm.

pros: One of the largest IT company, hence job security.
cons: Work assigned in some projects are not balance among staffs, bonuses varies across different department which is not fair.

pros: A very good company to work with. The company provides a large range of benefits which motivates the employees to work efficiently.
cons: Not much to say about cons in related to work in NCs. Its a nice place to work and nice people around.

pros: there are number of good colleagues and talented people with big organisation. It has many teams which have numerous growth if internal transfer.
cons: There are too much processes and internal politics. working hours may be too stretched for certain team and no define job scope.

- Good life balance

pros: cohesive envirionment, good bistro that serve nice food and many activities going on in ncs. Management is good. Fast help desk services which i appreciate that.
cons: long working hours, if met with the right boss whom protect the staff, it will be a great deal of luck. but if met with an incapable boss, your life will suffers, too many changes and too many re-op.

cons: Didn't get payed on time, poorly organised, kids often had nothing to do, were not payed enough for the hours we worked, no effort made to clock our hours

review_title: Flexible Project-Based Schedule and Good Team Culture
pros: Flexible project-base schedule. Most of the time working in data centre or customer side. Boss won't care whether you work in office or from home. Teammates are willing to help.
cons: No life during project peak. No good training system for fresh grads if he/she is not sure about their own career path.

review_title: Good work life balance, flexible, but poor in monetary compensations and basic benefits
